snippet: Prosecutors filed an appeal on Monday to block a court from granting a retrial to a former boxer convicted of murder whose release last week after 48 years on death row exposed problems in Japan’s justice system.
abstract: Japanese prosecutors file appeal to block a court from granting a retrial to Iwao Hakamada, former boxer convicted of murder whose release after 48 years on death row exposed problems in the country's justice system; appeal is seen as a face-saving move to prevent further scrutiny of prosecutors' reliance on forced confessions and possibly shoddy police work.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors filed an appeal on Monday to block a court from granting a retrial to a former boxer convicted of murder whose release last week after 48 years on death row exposed problems in Japan’s justice system.

headline.main: Japan: Man Freed From Death Row Faces New Effort to Block a Retrial
